metadata.title: CVE-2015-6823 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The allocate_buffers function in libavcodec/alac.c in FFmpeg before 2.7.2does not initialize certain context data, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (segmentation violation) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via crafted Apple Lossless Audio Codec (ALAC)data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
